text: RIP Col. Gene Nightengale My hero. My father.
Just the way the schedule-makers drew it up: The 1st place Milwaukee #Brewers in Phoenix for a 3-game series against the 1st place Arizona #Dbacks
Young #Pirates star Oneil Cruz suffers fractured ankle in home-plate collision
More #Rays history
The #Rays sitting atop the baseball world: 9-0. They rout the #Athletics 11-0
Now 4 homers for Judge New Home Run pace: 72
The Tampa Bay #Rays absolutely cruising to their 9th consecutive victory, up 10-0 over the Oakland #Athletics, outscoring them 30-5 so far this weekend.
The #Rays already up 5-0 as they bid to stay undefeated for the 9th game this season
Aaron Judge with HR No. 3 HR pace: 54

Sunday Notebook: The Arizona #Diamondbacks are 'changing the game' with aggressive style, putting the NL West on notice; dark horse destination for Shohei Ohtani; advice from one former rookie sensation to another; more.
Arizona #Dbacks OF Alek Thomas, who didn’t have a hit entering the night, now 4-for-4, raising his batting average from .000 to .200 in just two hours.
Anthony Rendon has suspension reduced to 4 games, apologizes, and begins serving it tonight.
Anthony Rendon was going to receive at least a 3-game suspension simply based on #Royals pitcher Amir Garrett’s 3-game suspension last year when he tossed water on a fan.
MLB suspends #Angels 3B Anthony Rondon for altercation with fan
The Milwaukee #Brewers have certainly found some offense: They have scored 22 runs in their last 16 innings. They lead the NY #Mets 10-0 in their home opener.

Boston #RedSox outfielder Adam Duvall and Colorado #Rockies 1B C.J. Cron are the first #MLB players of the week (well, weekend) in 2023. Duvall hit .571 with three doubles, one triple, two homers and eight RBI. Cron hit .467 with two doubles, three home runs and seven RBI.
Atlanta officially retires center field great Andruw Jones’ jersey, No. 25
MLB's opening weekend awards: Who made best/worst first impressions?
The Minnesota #Twins (3-0) Cleveland #Guardians (3-1), and Chicago #Whitesox (2-2) all with impressive opening weekends on the road in the AL Central
Just like how they drew it up: Mike Trout and Shohei Ohtani go back-to-back with HRs. Angels up 6-0
The wild #Orioles-#RedSox 3-game series at Fenway Park: 50 runs 74 hits 24 walks 53 strikeouts The Red Sox, who won 2 of the 3 games, scored 9 runs in each game.

Jeffrey Spring's day is over, six innings of no-hit ball, leaves with Tampa Bay #Rays leading 4-0 over the Detroit #Tigers. Check out his surreal stats for 2023 (spring training and regular season). 20 innings 5 hits 0 runs 3 walks 36 strikeouts
Tampa Bay #Rays starter Jeffrey Springs having quite the 2023 debut today: 6 innings 0 hits 0 runs 1 walk 12 strikeouts 81 pitches
Giancarlo Stanton’s 485-foot homer was career No. 380: He has now passed #SFGiants great Matt Williams, and Hall of Famers Tony Perez and Orlando Cepeda in the first weekend of this season.
Aaron Judge keeps on homering. No. 2.
MLB's opening weekend awards: Who made best/worst first impressions
Houston #Astros , defending World Series champions, ready to build on dynasty
Congratulations to #WhiteSox manager Pedro Grifol, who wins his major-league managerial debut, in front of his family and close friends.
The city of Chicago goes 2-0 on opening day. The #WhiteSox win, 3-2, ending the #Astros' 10-game winning streak on opening day.
Andrew Vaughn with a 2-run double, and suddenly the #WhiteSox are up 3-1, with the #Astros' 10-game Opening Day winning streak now in jeopardy.
And the first run of the game scores on a wild pitch. Houston #Astros, who have only two hits, are up 1-0
Dylan Cease ties a #WhiteSox franchise record with his 10 strikeouts on opening day.
Hector Neris escapes one-out, bases loaded jam, and the #WhiteSox have now left 10 runners on base in the first seven innings.
Welcome to the Show: Oscar Colas comes off the bench and singles in the first at-bat of his #MLB career
That is seven strikeouts for Chicago #WhiteSox ace Dylan Cease. Through 3 innings.

‘You got to go home some day”: Houston #Astros manager Dusty Baker could be managing his final season in the majors, but plans to keep his future plans private as he vies for another World Series title
Opening Night in Houston
The unveiling of the Astros World Series banner as the crowd breaks into a ‘We Want Houston’ chant.
Deafening ovation for injured Jose Altuve, who is wearing a pink hard cast on his right hand. He will have it removed Friday and placed in a soft cast.
Dusty Baker: Houston! Are you ready for another one?

The Houston #Astros pulling out all of the stops for their World Series celebration with the Clydesdales on the field and Astros owner Jim Crane and his wife, Whitney, riding on the carriage carrying the World Series trophy

MLB voluntarily recognized the union in September and opened negotiations on the CBA. Players can also earn more if they are in spring training longer than 4 weeks or participate in instructional leagues.
New raises, per union official; Rookie League salaries escalates from $4,800 to $19,800 per year. Low-A: $11,000 to $26,200 High-A: $11,000 to $27,300 AA: $13,800 to $30,250 AAA: $17,500 to $35,800
The Major League Players Association and #MLB reach 5-year deal for all minor league players, their first contract
Prayers to San Diego #Padres 3B coach Matt Williams, who has been diagnosed with colon cancer, and will undergo a leave of absence after Opening Day.

Best Opening Day records by teams in #MLB history, per @EliasSports : New York #Mets: 40-21, .656 winning percentage_including winning 40 of their last 53. Seattle #Mariners: 28-18, .609 Baltimore #Orioles: 71-50, .587 NY #Yankees: 67-52, .563 Chicago #Cubs: 80-65, .552
The #Phillies grab center fielder Cristian Pache from the Oakland #A's for pitcher Billy Sullivan, and place 1B Rhys Hoskins on the 60-day injured list.
Opening day preparations under way in Houston, home of the defending World Series champions
White Sox GM Rick Hahn on seeing former White Sox star Jose Abreu on opening night playing for the Astros: “It’s like seeing Jordan in a Wizards uniform’
White Sox GM Rick Hahn: ‘We know we have something to prove’ after underachieving 2022 season

Chicago White Sox closer Liam Hendriks is making encouraging progress in his battle with cancer and the Sox are hopeful he can return before June. Sox GM Rick Hahn says they didn’t place him on the 60-day injured list for a reason.
Chicago #WhiteSox All-Star shortstop Tim Anderson says he’s back to enjoying life, and has new energy.
Chicago #WhiteSox starter Dylan Cease on facing Jose Abreu on opening night vs the Houston #Astros: ‘It will be interesting. He’s a White Sox legend.’
Low-budget #Guardians have 'higher expectations' and hope to stun the baseball world again, this time, on the biggest stage
The defending World Series champion manager preparing for another season. #Dusty #Astros
They are ready to unveil their latest World Series championship banner in Houston
Shohei Ohtani says he’s ready to go for Opening Day
And Shohei Ohtani warming up in the bullpen
Awaiting first look of Shohei Ohtani since winning the WBC title

Angels manager Phil Nevin on the Ohtani-Trout matchup: "I was feeling like this is the greatest game in the world.There's no other sport,no other situation,that can create that kind of drama and atmosphere,1-on-1,the two best players in the world.That’s what makes our game great'
The thin free-agent pitching class just got even thinner with the #STLCards signing All-Star Miles Mikolas to a two-year, $40 million extension.

#Angels manager Phil Nevin said he couldn’t help but dream of Shohei Ohtani closing out a postseason game for the Angels after seeing Ohtani’s save in the WBC title game. Ohtani will pitch in a minor league game today, be the DH in the Freeway Series, and start Opening Day
Awful news: #Phillies 1B Rhys Hoskins tears his ACL and is out for the season.
Lars Nootbaar became an overnight cult hero in Japan

This is why the players union and large-market owners get upset with teams who receive revenue-sharing money but don't spend it on their payroll. Oakland A's: $62.2 million (5th-most profitable MLB team in 2022, per Forbes) Pittsburgh Pirates: $51.5 million (8th-most profitable)
Watch: MLB's commercials for new rules feature All-Stars, celebrities

Top 5 MLB team values per Forbes: Yankees:$7.1 billion Dodgers:$4.8 RedSox:$4.5 Cubs:$4.1 SFGiants:$3.7 Top 5 profits(2022) Mariners:$83.8M SFGiants:$74.9 RedSox:$71.6 Orioles:$64.7 A's:$62.2 Top 5 losses Mets:$138.5M Padres:$55.2 WhiteSox:$53.4 BlueJays:$33.7 Twins:$30.3
Calling it one the greatest experiences of their careers, MLB players can’t wait until 2026, expecting even more stars signing up to join them at the next World Baseball Classic
When's the next WBC? USA stars want to 'make sure everybody buys in'
Shohei Ohtani is going into the Hall of Fame, well, his cap for starters
More activity in Team Japan bullpen, and no, not Yu Darvish
One for the scrapbooks: Colorado #Rockies starter Kyle Freeman strikes out Shohei Ohtani and induces a double-play grounder from home-run king Munetaka Murakami in the same inning.
Colorado Rockies left-handed starter Kyle Freeland is the new USA pitcher
Trea Turner finally looks human (at least momentarily). He strikes out with two runners and two outs. Japan still clinging to a 2-1 lead.
Shosei Togo is the new Japan pitcher
Shohei Ohtani's pre-game speech to Team Japan.
Merrill Kelly's night is over. Loup is in.
The bases now loaded for #STLCards OF, Lars Nootbaar, who has become a cult hero in Japan.
Aaron Loup now warming up for USA
Munetaka Murakami's HR: 432 feet. 115.1-mph off his bat.
Murakami, the hero for Japan last night with his 2-run walk-off hit, hits a rocket into the upper deck on his first pitch tonight. Japan 1, USA 1
Trea Turner's HR traveled 406 feet, leaving his bat at 107-mph.
Trea Turner's 5 HRs ties a WBC record
The Phillies may have gotten a steal signing Trea Turner to that $300 million deal. Unreal.
Trea Turner! Once again! HR!
There are a lot of great baseball fans in the Down syndrome community, too!
Chicago White Sox IF Tim Anderson on playing in tonight’s WBC final: ‘This is kind of my World Series at the moment.’
USA manager Mark DeRosa says he was definitely surprised that Japan bypassed Yu Darvish as the starter for tonight’s WBC Final
Merrill Kelly, who will start for Team USA tonight, likely will have Brady Singer follow him

Mark DeRosa says he would have loved having Bryce Harper as part of Team USA, and says he wishes he had invited Harper to Miami to at least experience the atmosphere while he recovers from his Tommy John surgery.
USA manager Mark DeRosa, when asked if he wants to see a Shohei Ohtani-Mike Trout matchup tonight: ‘No, I’m good,” he said laughing
No matter how long Shohei Ohtani pitches tonight vs. USA, or if he even pitches, the #Angels say it will not jeopardize his opening day start.
Yu Darvish says he’s keeping in touch with the #Padres but that he’s unsure whether he’ll be fully built up and ready for opening day.
Yu Darvish says he’s ready to pitch tonight but has not been informed when he’s expected to enter the game.
RIP, NBA great Hall of Famer Willis Reed

The ticket demand for tonight's WBC Finals with Japan-USA have skyrocketed. The average purchase price: $185, 255% more expensive than the average purchase price of an MLB game last season, per TickPick. The most expensive purchase: 2 tickets in Section FL1, Row AA: $1,882
The last hour of peace and quiet at loanDepot Park before Japan and USA take the field for batting practice before tonight’s WBC championship
It’s 5 hours before game time and Shohei Ohtani fans already are lined up outside the ballpark in Miami

Shohei Ohtani, who vows he’ll be ready to pitch, now set to deliver Baseball Classic grand finale on the biggest stage of his career: USA vs. Japan Mike Trout vs. Ohtani Tonight: An international baseball game for the ages
Taijuan Walker is first volunteer for 2026 WBC #TeamMexico
How did Randy Arozarena spend his time during the pitching change? Yep, once again, signing autographs for the fans in left field
Patrick Sandoval with huge standing ovation walking off the field. He's replaced by Jose Urquidy, which should set up Taijuan Walker for the championship game if Mexico hangs on.
Randy Arozarena! Again! Spectacular catch to rob a home run.
Roki Sasaki is done for the night.
Roki Sasaki lit up the radar gun with 26 pitches at 100-mph or faster through four innings, but his night looks like it's done. He's at 64 pitches and activity continues in the Japan bullpen.
Luis Urias with a 3-run bomb off Sasaki, and Mexico is up 3-0
Roki Sasaki now 19 pitches at 100-mph or higher. In 3 innings.
Team Japan pitcher Roki Sasaki has throwing 15 pitches at 100-mph or higher. In just two innings.
Mexico starter Patrick Sandoval does it in his own style, not throwing a pitch above 95-mph, and striking out the side. Yes, including #Angels teammate Shohei Ohtani
Roki Sasaki pitches a 1-2-3 first inning: 5 pitches at 100-mph or faster. Strikeout Fly out Strikeout
The scouts section is filled with all eyes on Japanese sensation Roku Sasaki, who just threw 101-mph with his first pitch
For the right to play USA in the World Baseball Classic: Mexico vs. Japan
Shohei Ohtani with huge ovation and later crosses his arms showing respect to Mexico’s Randy Arozarena
The best pre-game show before the Mexico-Japan game: Randy Arozarena wearing a sombrero and cowboy boots during batting practice and Shohei Ohtani hitting homers into the upper deck
Yes, that is Randy Arozarena playing left field during batting practice for Team Mexico, wearing a sombrero and cowboy boots.
Attendance for tonight’s Cuba-USA game: 35,779 (sellout)

Paul Goldschmidt having quite the game, driving in two more runs, and now USA is threatening to mercy-rule Cuba: USA leads 9-2, and if they have a 10-run or greater lead after seven innings, the game ends.

Miles Mikolas is warming up now to replace Adam Wainwright, which leaves Merrill Kelly and Brady Singer, and possibly Kyle Freeland, to start Tuesday in the potential WBC championship game against Japan or Mexico. USA is up 5-1 in the 4th inning.
Trea Turner's last two pitches: 2 HRs 5 RBI
Trea Turner again!
And Paul Goldschmidt answers back with 2-run HR.
Jose Altuve injury has Daniel Bard feeling awful
Cuba doesn't hit the ball out of the infield in the first inning: Lead 1-0.
That is three soft infield hits, and Cuba has the bases loaded with no outs to start this game.
Marlins heroes Livan Hernandez and Jeff Conine throwing out the ceremonial first pitches
Trea Turner gets huge ovation in introductions: He was the Sunday night hero when his WBC grand slam causes Team USA to 'black out'
WBC's Cuba vs. USA semifinal in Miami is fraught with tension with one proud Cuban-American family making no secret of their allegiance
Cuba lining up for its historic first game in a Miami

USA lineup vs. Cuba in WBC semifinal game: Mookie Betts RF Mike Trout CF Paul Goldschmidt 1B Nolan Arenado 3B Kyle Schwarber LF Will Smith C Pete Alonso DH Tim Anderson 2B Trea Turner SS Adam Wainwright P
Mark DeRosa now working his day job hours before managing Team USA vs Cuba tonight
Attendance for tonight's USA-Venezuela game: 35,792 (sellout)
Salvador Perez has this place going wild. Run-scoring double, tie game, 5-5
Daniel Bard: Walk Single Hit by Pitch Wild Pitch Walk Wild pitch Walk
Jose Altuve is hurt, holding right wrist after Daniel Bard's fastball hits him. He leaves the game. The #Astros holding their breath.
Daniel Bard now in the game, replacing starter Lance Lynn, for USA.
Houston #Astros RF Kyle Tucker with monster game for USA. He has singled, doubled, and now homered. USA up 5-2
The severe flaw with instant replay exposed.

Venezuela 1B Luis Arraez was having a blast even before he belted the 2-run HR to ignite the crowd: “I'm dreaming,’’ Arraez said before the game. “Right now, I'm dreaming. Am I here? Am I here? Yes, I'm enjoying this a lot.''
Luis Arraez goes deep for 2-run homer, and it's LOUD in Miami, with USA's lead cut to 3-2 over Venezuela
And Martin Perez is already knocked out of the game.
Venezuela's bullpen is up in a hurry as Martin Perez has given up 5 hits to the first 5 batters with USA threatening an early blowout.
Make it 2-0 now
A single, a bloop, and a two-base error, and USA already on top 1-0 just two batters into the game.
Ceremonial first pitches by King Felix Hernandez and Adam Jones tonight
Venezuela, the hometown favorite, getting huge ovations in pregame introductions, the loudest reserved for Detroit #Tigers great Miguel Cabrera
And Mexico has now gone ahead, 5-4, with all of Alexis Diaz's baserunners coming around to score.
Isaac Paredes delivers a 2-out, 2-run single, and Mexico has come all of the way back, tying the game at 4-apiece.
Alexis Diaz, brother of Edwin Diaz, doesn't retire a batter in the 7th and is pulled from the game with the bases loaded an no outs. Puerto Rico hanging onto a 4-2 lead.
Attendance for tonight's Puerto Rico-Mexico game: 35,817. A sellout
And here is Alexis Diaz, brother of Edwin Diaz, with Edwin's jersey shown on the scoreboard, as he enters the game.
Verdugo drops a bloop single in front of Hernandez, knocking Stroman out of the game. Puerto Rico leads 4-2 in the 5th.
Boston #RedSox outfielder Alex Verdugo steps to the plate with one out and the bases loaded for Team Mexico with Red Sox teammate Enrique Hernandez standing in center field for Puerto Rico
Mets center fielder Brandon Nimmo left the game with right ankle soreness, the Mets say, and will undergo imaging Saturday.

Team Mexico starter Julio Urias out of the game after going four innings: 5 hits, 4 earned runs, 1 walk, 4 strikeouts. He threw 60 pitches, 20 fewer than permitted by WBC starters this round, but was never going to throw more than 65 pitches, preparing for Dodgers opening day.
Oh-oh. Now #Mets center fielder Brandon Nimmo limps off the field in their spring training game tonight. The Mets need to wrap their team in bubble wrap until opening day
Javier Baez and Eddie Rosario got back-to-back homers off Julio Urias and Puerto Rico up 4-0 in the first inning over Mexico
Tampa Bay #Rays outfielder Randy Arozarena (7-for-14, 6 R, 5 2B, 1 HR, 9 RBI) earned the MVP award for his performance for Mexico in Pool C in Phoenix.
Hall of Famer Pudge Rodriguez throws out the ceremonial first pitch
Puerto Rico and Mexico about to get underway
Mexico manager Benji Gil says baseball fans would be watching the USA game no matter what channel it was televised, which now becomes disadvantage to Mexico robbing them of critical day off.
Attendance for tonight's USA-Colombia game: 29,856

Team USA is three outs away from advancing to the quarterfinals, but the reality is that they already are in. USA leads 3-2 in the 9th, and they would have to lose by 4 or more runs for Colombia to advance under the WBC tiebreaker rules. So even if Colombia wins, they still lose
Mike Trout with big 2-out, 2-run single, and USA takes its first lead of the night, 3-2, over Colombia. If they win, they play Venezuela on Saturday in the quarterfinals.
The #Mets announce that Edwin Diaz will undergo an MRI on Thursday on his right knee.

Kike' Hernandez says Edwin Diaz was their clubhouse leader: "He has a really big bank account, but his heart is way bigger than his bank account is. He's one of the really special human beings we got in that clubhouse. .It sucks. ..It's a big blow in more ways than one. ''

Puerto Rico infielder Kike' Hernandez on clubhouse mood after Edwin Diaz knee injury: "Quiet. ... It's real easy to set aside the game and worry about us as humans. So it definitely doesn't feel in there like we just beat the Dominican Republic to advance.''
Devastating. The WBC is the first time Alexis and Edwin Díaz played on the same baseball team in their lives.
Heartbreaking seeing Edwin Diaz’s brother, Alexis, crying as the #Mets All-Star closer leaves the field in a stretcher after injuring his knee in Puerto Rico’s celebration
New York #Mets All-Star closer Edwin Diaz being helped off the field with a right knee injury after Puerto Rico just recorded the final out
Puerto Rico wins, 5-2, sending the powerful Dominican Republic home
Tim Anderson looks like a man who could win a Gold Glove at second base.
Mike Trout, who hasn't had more than two triples in a season since 2018, hits a stand-up triple in the first inning for USA tonight.
Team USA could actually lose by 3 or fewer runs to Colombia tonight, and still advance to the quarterfinals, but manager Mark DeRosa doesn’t want to hear it
Team Mexico 1B Rowdy Tellez, when asked his thoughts of watching teammate Randy Arozarena signing autographs during a pitching change in the game. ‘Hey, that’s Randy Arozarena.’’
The man of the hour: Randy Arozarena, who carried Mexico on its back to the quarterfinals
No surprise, but Canada manager Ernie Whitt announces that #Dodgers All-Star first baseman Freddie Freeman is officially out for rest of the WBC with his strained hamstring
Cuba, who lost the first two games of the WBC, is going to Miami. They are the first team to advance to the WBC semifinals.
Ken Griffey Jr., Team USA's hitting coach, loving role in WBC

LA #Dodgers ace Julio Urias will not throw a single pitch Wednesday in Mexico's critical WBC game vs. Canada. Manager Benji Gil: "I would love to win this tournament....but I have to protect his career. If he would come out [of the bullpen], I would tackle him to stop him.''
Attendance for Tuesday's WBC doubleheader at Chase Field in Phoenix: Canada-Colombia: 10,571 Great Britain-Mexico: 17,705

Great Britain manager Drew Spencer walked away proud and complimented everyone on his team for its gutty performance in the country's first World Baseball Classic. "I don't think people will see Great Britain on the schedule again in the future, and think that's our easy game.''

Mexico hangs on and beats Great Britain, 2-1, and now the Pool C scenario is simple. The winner of Mexico-Canada on Thursday will automatically advance to the quarterfinals. If USA defeats Colombia Thursday night, they will be the other Pool C team in the quarterfinals in Miami

Great Britain is threatening to send Pool C into utter chaos. They are tied with Mexico, 1-1, entering the 7th. If Great Britain wins tonight... And if Mexico beats Canada tomorrow afternoon .... And if Colombia beats USA tomorrow night.... There will be an insane 5-way tie!
Starter Taijuan Walker with a dominant outing for Team Mexico: 4 innings 1 hit 0 runs 1 walks 8 strikeouts.
MLB says it fully expects all games to continue to be televised by Bally’s in spite of Diamond Sports Group’s bankruptcy. In the event they are not, MLB will pick them up

Venezuela will meet No. 2 seed in Pool C in the quarterfinals, which currently is USA (Mexico holds tiebreaker advantage). The Winner of the Dominican Republic-Puerto Rico game will play the No. 1 seed, which would be Mexico (if they beat Great Britain and Canada in next 2 games)

The Dominican Republic wind 10-0 over Israel setting up epic matchup Wednesday night against Puerto Rico. Winner goes to quarterfinals Loser goes home. Venezuela now clinches top seed in Pool D and a quarterfinal berth.

The Diamond Sports Group, after filing for bankruptcy, says that the Bally Sports regional sports networks (“RSN”) will continue to carry the baseball games at this point while it goes through a restructuring.
Diamond Sports Group officially files for bankruptcy
One last workout for Team USA, with manager Mark DeRosa taking a few cuts, before they face Colombia on Wednesday night. If USA wins, they are off to Miami on Thursday morning
Great Britain manager Drew Spencer on their historic victory: ‘The feeling is absolute elation.’’
Great Britain celebrating its historic victory

Great Britain hands USA a gift by stunning Colombia, 7-5, for the biggest baseball victory in its history. Great Britain's victory means that Team USA is back controlling its own fate. If USA beats Canada tonight and Colombia on Wednesday, they will be in the WBC quarterfinals.
Attendance for today's Colombia-Great Britain game: 10,116
Seattle #Mariners prized prospect Harry Ford goes deep, and Great Britain takes a 6-3 lead over Colombia. They are six outs away from winning their first WBC game in history.
Great Britain has scored five unanswered runs and now up 5-3 over Colombia entering the sixth inning.

RIP #Yankees great Joe Pepitone. "As a native New Yorker, he embraced everything about being a Yankee during both his playing career_which included three All-Star appearances and three Gold Gloves-and in the decades thereafter,'' the Yankees said in a statement.

Great Britain comes back with a 3-run fourth inning, tying Colombia 3-3 entering the 5th inning. If Colombia loses, USA will control their own fate in the WBC pool by simply beating Canada tonight and Colombia on Wednesday, and advancing to the quarterfinals in Miami.
The Dominican Republic bounces back, beats Nicaragua, 6-1. Manny Machado doubles and homers. Next game: Team Israel on Tuesday.

The pitchers prohibited from appearing in today's WBC Phoenix games because of pitch counts: USA: Daniel Bard, Brady Singer, Nick Martinez. Canada: Cal Quantrill,Evan Rutcky Colombia: Nabil Crismatt Great Britain: Donovan Benoit,Akeel Morris, Andre Scrubb,Alex Webb, Vance Worley

It’s not just Team USA, but virtually all WBC managers are under instructions from affiliated teams: Texas #Rangers pitching prospect Mitch Bratt is starting tonight for Team Canada vs USA, but will be pulled before the WBC-allotted 65 pitches, Canada manager Ernie Whitt says.

San Diego #Padres star Juan Soto is in today’s Dominican Republic lineup, but can not start in back-to-back games, manager Rodney Linares says, because of restrictions by the Padres. He had left calf tightness his final few days in spring training camp, so Padres being cautious.
Joey Meneses, baseball journeyman, leads Mexico over USA in WBC with two homers, and becomes overnight cult hero in Mexico as fans celebrate
Bobby Witt Jr. 'soaking it all in' as Team USA's youngest WBC player
Team Mexico fans are still celebrating in downtown Phoenix into the wee hours of the morning, three hours after game ended
And 2 hours, 54 minutes into the game, we have our first 1-2-3 inning.

Tale of the tape after four innings of Canada-Great Britain game: 24 runs 22 hits 19 walks 10 pitchers Canada leads 16-8. Time of the game through 4 innings: 2 hours, 46 minutes. *There is a mercy rule that ends the game if a team leads by 15 runs after 5 or 10 runs after 7.

Seattle #Mariners prized catching prospect Harry Ford with a 3-run homer for Great Britain, and the wildness continues. Canada 10 Great Britain 8 4th inning Time of game: 2 hours, 3 minutes and counting.
St. Louis Cardinals OF Tyler O'Neill with a 3-run double for Team Canada, and they are now up 10-5 over Great Britain in the third inning.
The first inning is finally over: Canada 5, Great Britain 3. Time of the inning: 46 minutes. Game pace: 6 hours, 54 minutes.

Wild first inning in the Canada-Great Britain game here in Phoenix. Canada 4, Great Britain 3. Combined pitching line for the two starters: 1 inning: 6 hits, 7 runs, 6 walks, 2 strikeouts. And it's still in the first inning: 31 minutes and counting.
Rough outing for Canada starter Cal Quantrill, who gives up three runs and is pulled with the bases loaded and two outs in the first inning. He threw 37 pitches. Great Britain up 3-0 in the 1st.
Smaller crowd today for Canada-Great Britain WBC game, but tonight’s USA-Mexico game is sold out at Chase Field in Phoenix.
Chicago #Whitesox veteran Lance Lynn is scheduled to start Monday for Team USA vs. Canada

Cuba loses its first two games but still advances to quarterfinals along with Italy by winning 5-team tiebreaker. All five teams in Pool A: Cuba, Netherlands, Panama, Chinese Taipei finished with 2-2 records.
Japan has trounced opponents 35-8 in its four victories with pitching star Yoshinobu Yamamoto lined up to potentially face USA if they meet in Miami.

Sunday Notebook: Bobby Witt Jr. 'soaking it all in' as Team USA's youngest WBC player; Angels Opening Day plans prevent Shohei Ohtani from pitching vs USA in potential WBC matchup; Italy stays caffeinated in dugout; more.
World Baseball Classic gives Nolan Arenado chance to dream big
Congratulations to Adam Wainwright who won his 200th career game tonight: Regular Season: 195 Postseason: 4 WBC: 1
Adam Wainwright on his WBC debut: ‘I’ll remember this for the rest of my life.’’
Stunning turnaround. Team Colombia goes double, double, homer off Julio Urias, and just like that, Mexico is down 3-1 in front of stunned crowd.
Make it four perfect innings and 45 pitches for Julio Urias. Pitchers are limited to 65 pitches in the first round.

The Arizona #Dbacks lock up their face of the franchise by signing outfielder Corbin Carroll to an eight-year, $111 million deal. There's also a club option in 2031 that could make the deal worth $134 million, per @SteveGilbertMLB

Dodgers ace Julio Urias is in mid-season form, opening the game for Mexico with three perfect innings and needing only 33 pitches. And, yes, he is about to be paid. He is a free agent after the season.
Rays OF Randy Arozarena of Team Mexico greets his first WBC pitch with a double off the wall, and Mexico is off and running with Julio Urias pitching a 1-2-3 first inning.
RIP legendary Minnesota Vikings coach Bud Grant

The Washington #Nationals officially announce their eight-year, $50 million deal for catcher Keibert Ruiz, buying out all of his pre-arbitration and arbitration years, and the first 3 years of free agency, with two club option years, too. He's going to be a Nat for a looong time
Crowd still pouring into Chase Field with fans already chanting for hometown favorite, Team Mexico
Rio Gomez, the son of late beloved ESPN broadcaster, introduced for the first time in the ballpark he grew up watching games at Chase Field. The Boston #Redsox prospect is pitching for Team Colombia.
Patrick Sandoval says he’s excited for Mexico’s home-field advantage in Phoenix as fans already lining up for gates to open
Fans getting ready for Mexico-Colombia WBC game
Team Japan is the first WBC team to qualify for the quarterfinals by winning once again, 10-2, over the Czech Republic. They are a powerhouse.
Team USA strives to put World Baseball Classic on the map….in its own country
He replaces injured pitcher Brooks Raley
LA #Angels pitcher Aaron Loup now joins Team USA
Adam Wainwright honored and humbled to start Game 1 for Team USA in WBC
Freddie Freeman honors late mother by playing for Team Canada in WBC

USA manager Mark DeRosa says he’s blown away by Dodgers OF Mookie Betts’ preparation and is absolutely convinced he could play every position on the field. For the WBC, he’ll stick to RF and second base
Mark DeRosa, when asked how it felt managing his first game for Team USA, ‘I’ll let you know when I relax.’
San Diego #Padres OF Juan Soto, who still hopes to play for the Dominican Republic, was in attendance for tonight’s USA-SF Giants game

The crowd groans when Mike Trout is hit in the arm by a pitch from #SFGiants starter Anthony DeSciafini, but he remains in the game. He's scheduled for just a couple of at-bats and likely will play most of the game Thursday against his #Angels teammates.

WBC manager Mark DeRosa spoke to legendary Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski before coming out, curious since he coached the USA Redeem Team in the 2008 Olympics. "He said just to get them to understand you're not playing for the United States, that you are part of the United States.''

The hiring of GM Dana Brown, with Dusty Baker has manager, marks only the 2nd time in #MLB history that a team has had a Black GM and Black manager at the same time. The only other instance was #WhiteSox GM Ken Williams and manager Jerry Manuel from 2000-2003.
